output.description: Data from the specified row in the Supabase table
output.title: Table row data

group.name: Supabase
group.description: Nodes for connecting with your Supabase tables and perform actions on your data.

meta.name: Get Row
meta.description: Fetch a row from a Supabase table using the API URL, Key, table name, filter, and Authorization token.

filter.description:
The filter to select specific rows to get. You can update specific rows using horizontal filters, e.g. `eq`, `lt`, and `is`. Leave empty to get all the rows in the table.

**SAMPLE INPUT:** 
- To get a row having the `id` equal to `1`: `id=eq.1`
- To get a row having `breed` value equal to `Beagle`: `breed=eq.Shih Tzu`

**To use multiple filters**, use the `&` operator to separate them. 
**For example**, to filter records where the `origin` field equals `Germany` and the `lifespan` field is greater than `15`, you would use the following filter: 
```
age=gt.30&price=lt.10
```

Learn more about using Filters [here](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/supabase-crud#filters).
filter.title: Filter

supabaseKey.description:
The API Key of the Supabase instance. You can get your API Key from the [Supabase Dashboard](https://supabase.com/dashboard/projects) under Settings > API.

TIP: Check out our [Supabase Tutorial](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/supabase-crud) to dig in deeper.
supabaseKey.title: API Key

supabaseUrl.description: Your Supabase project URL. (Get it from your [Supabase Project](https://supabase.com/dashboard/projects) API Reference.)
supabaseUrl.title: API URL

table.description: The name of the table in the Supabase instance
table.title: Table Name

schema.description: This input can be any string and will be sent as an Authorization header along with the request
schema.title: Authorization Header

columns.description:
List the columns to select, comma separated. This will get all the values for the specified columns. Leave empty to get all the values in the table.

**SAMPLE INPUT:**
To get all the entries for the `id` column and the `breed` column, use: `id, breed`

group.name: Supabase
group.description: Nodes for connecting with your Supabase tables and perform actions on your data.

supabaseKey.description:
The API Key of the Supabase instance. You can get your API Key from the [Supabase Dashboard](https://supabase.com/dashboard/projects) under Settings > API.

TIP: Check out the [Supabase Tutorial](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/supabase-crud) to learn more.
supabaseKey.title: API Key

objectData.description:
The JSON object to be inserted into the table.

**SAMPLE INPUT:**
```
{
  "id": 5,
  "breed": "Birman",
  "origin": "Burma",
  "lifespan": 12
}
```

Or, for multiple rows:
```
[
  {
    "id": 5,
    "breed": "Birman",
    "origin": "Burma",
    "lifespan": 12
  },
  {
    "id": 6,
    "breed": "Bombay",
    "origin": "United States",
    "lifespan": 15
  }
]
```
objectData.title: Object

supabaseUrl.description: The URL of your Supabase instance. (Get it from your [Supabase Project](https://supabase.com/dashboard/projects) API Reference.)
supabaseUrl.title: API URL

table.description: The name of the table in Supabase to insert the object into.
table.title: Table Name

token.description:
Your Supabase Auth Token from the client. This allows Supabase Row Level Security to be utilized as a passthrough with Buildship. Learn more on [when to use tokens](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/supabase-crud#when-to-use-tokens).

TIP ðŸ’¡: If you do not have an Authentication Token, use the Supabase "Create Row" node instead.
token.title: Token

output.title: Response

meta.name: Delete Row
meta.description: Delete an existing table row using Supabase Realtime API endpoint.

filter.description:
The filter to select specific rows to delete. You can update specific rows using horizontal filters, e.g. `eq`, `lt`, and `is`. 

**SAMPLE INPUT:** 
- To delete a row having the `id` equal to `1`: `id=eq.1`
- To delete a row having `breed` value equal to `Beagle`: `breed=eq.Shih Tzu`

**To use multiple filters**, use the `&` operator to separate them. 
**For example**, to filter records where the `origin` field equals `Germany` and the `lifespan` field is greater than `15`, you would use the following filter: 
``
age=gt.30&price=lt.10
``

Learn more about using Filters [here](https://docs.buildship.com/tutorials/supabase-crud#filters).
